means: 使隔离(isolate的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: Amy had the growing sense that she was adrift and isolated.
sentence.Network_cn: 埃米愈发感到自己孤立无援，孑然一身。

sentence.Network_en: Many of the refugee villages are in isolated areas.
sentence.Network_cn: 很多难民村落都在偏远地区。

sentence.Network_en: They said the allegations related to an isolated case of cheating.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们说这些指控与另一件欺诈案有关。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent.: from French isolé, from Italian isolato, from late Latin insulatus 'made into an island', from Latin insula 'island'

entry.def: An isolated place is a long way away from large towns and is difficult to reach.

example.ex: Many of the refugee villages are in isolated areas...
example.tran: 很多难民村落都在偏远地区。

example.ex: Aubrey's family's farm is very isolated.
example.tran: 奥布里家的农场非常偏僻。

entry.tran: 孤独的;孤寂的;孤立无援的
entry.def: If you feel isolated, you feel lonely and without friends or help.

example.ex: Men can feel isolated at work...
example.tran: 人们工作时可能感到孤立无助。

example.ex: Some patients may become very isolated and depressed.
example.tran: 一些病人可能变得非常孤独沮丧。

entry.def: An isolated example is an example of something that is not very common.

example.ex: They said the allegations related to an isolated case of cheating.
example.tran: 他们说这些指控与另一件欺诈案有关。

means.word_mean: 2. being or feeling set or kept apart from others;

sentences.sentence: "could not remain the isolated figure he had been"- Sherwood Anderson
"thought of herself as alone and separated from the others"

means.word_mean: 3. marked by separation of or from usually contiguous elements;

sentences.sentence: "little isolated worlds, as abruptly disjunct and unexpected as a palm-shaded well in the Sahara"- Scientific Monthly
"several stranded fish in a tide pool"

means.word_mean: 5. under forced isolation especially for health reasons;
6. remote and separate physically or socially;

sentences.sentence: "existed over the centuries as a world apart"
"preserved because they inhabited a place apart"- W.H.Hudson
"tiny isolated villages remote from centers of civilization"

auth_sentence.content: It was clearly an isolated case, he said.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was clearly an isolated case, he said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was clearly an isolated case, he said.

auth_sentence.content: The Guardian calls him "an isolated chancellor".
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Guardian calls him "an isolated chancellor".

auth_sentence.content: But his has been a fairly isolated public voice.
auth_sentence.res_content: But his has been a fairly isolated public voice.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But his has been a fairly isolated public voice.

Sentence.sentence: In Japan young women may be rebelling against their mothers' isolated lives of child rearing.
They are more or less isolated from the outside world.
Case studies of children who were isolated from others reveal that they lack a firm self-concept, and their mental and psychological development is severely hindered by lack of language.

sentences.en: The radical group in the ruling party is becoming increasingly isolated.
sentences.cn: 执政党内的激进派日益孤立。

sentences.en: People with contagious diseases should be isolated.
sentences.cn: 传染病患者应予以隔离。
